      • hasPermission

        public static boolean hasPermission(Context context,
                                    java.lang.String permissionName)
        Used to check whether the application has given permission defined or not.
        Parameters:
        context - -Context.
        permissionName - -Permission granted in android.Manifest.permission.
        Returns:
        boolean -true if the permission is defined in manifest, else false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any String parameter is empty or null.
        See Also:
        PackageManager#checkPermission(String, String)}.

      • isGoogleTV

        public static boolean isGoogleTV(Context context)
        Used to check whether the system has feature for Google TV or not.
        Parameters:
        context - -Context.
        Returns:
        boolean -true if the system has feature com.google.android.tv
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        See Also:
        PackageManager#hasSystemFeature(String)}.

      • getAppDirectory

        public static java.lang.String getAppDirectory(Context context)
                                        throws NameNotFoundException
        Get the current Application directory path.
        E.g., /data/data/com.app.path
        Parameters:
        context - -Context.
        Returns:
        String -return the application directory path or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters is null.
        NameNotFoundException
        See Also:
        PackageManager#getPackageInfo(String, int)}., ApplicationInfo#dataDir}.
